data.title: Subject and Course Guides at University of Texas at Arlington
data.meta_description: Tips on making the most of Google Scholar
data.text:
Google Scholar searches scholarly literature provided by academic publishers, professional societies, universities, and scholarly organizations. Mostly, Google Scholar provides citation-only results. However, the full-text of an article or book can be accessed by using the "Find it @ UTA" link when it's available.

When on campus you do not need to make any changes. When using Google Scholar off-campus, you will need to set your ‘Library Links’ to The University of Texas at Arlington. Once you complete the steps below, you will then see the "Find it @ UTA" link on some of your search results. Clicking that link will connect you directly with the appropriate database.
